intro: Styphelia concurva, commonly known as the bent-stem heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Australia, where it thrives in sandy soils and humid climates. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, evergreen leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pink, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the spring and summer months. Styphelia concurva is well adapted to coastal environments, showing resistance to salt spray and strong winds.
